sentence.Network_en: What we intend to halt, by any means, is three centuries of spoliation of this earth.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们所要做的, 就是用任何方法, 阻止三个世纪以来对这个地球所进得的掠夺.

PerfectNetExp.abs: (nationalization)、没收(condemnation)、充公(confiscation)、强夺(spoliation)、征用(requisition)、扣押(sequester)、集体化(collectivization)、本地化(indigenization).
毁灭文件 Spoliation  毁灭物证 Destroy the material evidence; spoliation  毁灭证据 Destroy evidence; destruction of evidence; spoliation  毁灭罪证 Destroy.

list.abs: spoliation 强夺spoliator 抢劫者spoliatory 抢劫的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting pillaging): from Latin spoliatio(n-), from the verb spoliare 'strip, deprive' (see spoil)

means.word_mean: 1. (law) the intentional destruction of a document or an alteration of it that destroys its value as evidence
2. the act of stripping and taking by force
